item.title: Drawing antialiased circles in OpenGL
item.description: In this post we will look at the fwidth function in GLSL, and how it can be used to draw circles (or other 2D shapes) with resolution independent antialiasing. We will be drawing the circles in the fragment shader, using a threshold on the distance from the center of a quad that fills the entire OpenGL viewport (modeled by two triangles). item.title: About
item.description: My name is Ruben De Visscher. I started as a researcher at the Royal Observatory of Belgium working on solar image processing. Now I am working as a full stack software engineer at Awingu. My personal interests include high performance computing, (real time) graphics, programming languages, distributed computing, machine learning and information security. I prefer working with modern C++ or one of the newer contenders (e.g. Rust) for bare metal work, or Python when I need something done quickly or with massive library support.
